title: L.A. Home Where You Can Train Like The Hulk Lists for $3.9 Million
text:
Lou Ferrigno ’s life is imitating his art. The 2009 comedy “I Love You, Man” revolves partly around a real-estate agent’s attempt to sell Mr. Ferrigno’s Los Angeles home, with the actor playing himself. Now Mr. Ferrigno is listing his real life Los Angeles-area home for $3.9 million.

“It’s funny—it’s like I’m repeating what happened” in the movie, said Mr. Ferrigno, 67, a former professional bodybuilder and actor who played the title role in TV’s “The Incredible Hulk.” He pointed out that he doesn’t have a huge statue of himself in the backyard, as depicted in the film; the statue is smaller, and located inside the house.

‘It’s funny—it’s like I’m repeating what happened’ in the movie, said Mr. Ferrigno, referring to the 2009 comedy ‘I Love You, Man.’ The movie revolves partly around a real-estate agent’s attempt to sell Mr. Ferrigno’s Los Angeles home, with the actor playing himself. Photo: DreamWorks/Everett Collection

There are a few other differences as well. In the movie, Mr. Ferrigno lives in a massive, highly modern multilevel home with a view of the city. In reality he lives in Santa Monica, not too far from the beach, in a traditional-style home built in the 1920s, said Alphonso Lascano of Hilton & Hyland, who has the listing with colleague Bjorn Farrugia.

Located in the Gillette’s Regent Square area, the yellow, brick and stucco home measures about 3,500 square feet with five bedrooms. It sits on a roughly 9,000-square-foot lot, which is large for Santa Monica, Mr. Lascano said. Many older homes in this area are being torn down and replaced with new, larger houses, said Mr. Lascano, who said the same thing is likely to happen to this house, Hulk-related history aside.

Located in the Gillette’s Regent Square area, Mr. Ferrigno’s home measures about 3,500 square feet with five bedrooms. Photo: Sean Gordon

Mr. Ferrigno and his wife Carla Ferrigno have lived in the house since 1980, when they bought it for $547,000, according to public records. At the time Mr. Ferrigno was in the midst of his stint playing the Hulk, he said, and the couple liked that the house was convenient to filming locations and the beach.

Mr. Ferrigno and his wife Carla Ferrigno have lived in the house since 1980, while Mr. Ferrigno was in the midst of his stint playing the title role in TV’s ‘The Incredible Hulk.’ Photo: Universal/Everett Collection

Mr. Ferrigno, who also works as a personal trainer, turned a free-standing garage on the property into what he calls “the best home gym in the country,” a roughly 1,000-square-foot space where he said he has trained the likes of Michael Jackson and Chuck Norris over the years.

The couple raised their three children in the house, Mr. Ferrigno said. They are selling because they’ve purchased a property in Northern California on roughly 6 acres, and Mr. Ferrigno said he’s looking forward to having more space for a “man cave,” where he can do woodworking and store his collection of rifles and bows and arrows. Plus, “I like to be in the woods and the country,” he said.

As a bodybuilder, Mr. Ferrigno won a Mr. America and two Mr. Universe titles, and appeared in the bodybuilding documentary, “Pumping Iron.” In addition to the television show, he has played the Hulk in several movies.

Write to Candace Taylor at Candace.Taylor@wsj.com
description: Lou Ferrigno, who played the fictional superhero on television, is selling his Santa Monica property with what he calls ‘the best home gym in the country.’
